My Journey

Where I am from and how I arrived where I am.

  • 2002 - 2008, Adolescence

    Chang-Jun

    I programmed for six years to solve algorithmic problems and participated programming contests. This rooted my interests in computational approachs in research

  • 2008 - 2012, Undergraduate

    Peking University

    I turned to study human behavior and cognition. I majored in Psychology, and focused on vision study.

    I joined Cognition and Cognition Lab led by Dr. Sheng Li. Here, we study human discriminates complex visual stimuli and form new categories of them.

  • May - August, 2011

    University of Pennsylvania

    With Dr. Geoff Aguirre , we combine computational methods and neuroimaging together, study how to use machine learning algorithms to decode signals in visual cortex of blind patients and normal people.

  • July 2013

    Cold Spring Harbor Asia

    We focused on computational and theoretical issues: computations from synapses to behavior, from sensation to cognition. They ignited my interests in understanding computational mechanisms of human cognition.

  • 2013 - Present, Graduate

    Johns Hopkins University

    At Visual Thinking Lab, with Dr. Jonathan Flombaum, We study to understand the computational algorithms used by visual perception, and cognition in general.

    We aim at breaking some of these enigmas.
